intro: Hermannia stipulacea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in clusters and attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Hermannia stipulacea is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
